text.*:
This article needs additional citations for verification. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. (February 2009) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)

Toronto Public Health is a city department of the City of Toronto and is responsible for promoting public health policy in the city.

The current department was formed in 1998, replacing the public health units of the former cities of Toronto, York, North York, Scarborough and Etobicoke and the borough of East York.

The department has an approximate budget of $182,672,000 (2004).[1]

Contents

  • 1 Medical Officer of Health
  • 2 Medical Officer of Health, old City of Toronto
  • 3 See also
  • 4 External links
  • 5 References

Medical Officer of Health[edit]

  • Dr. Sheela Basrur – 1998–2005
  • Dr. Barbara Yaffe – 2005 (acting): now Director of Communicable Disease Control and Associate MOH
  • Dr. David McKeown – 2005–2017: former Medical Officer of Health, Borough of East York, City of Toronto and Region of Peel
  • Dr. Eileen de Villa - 2017-present: former Medical Officer of Health for the Region of Peel

Medical Officer of Health, old City of Toronto[edit]

  • Dr Gordon Park Jackson (1885-1951) 1929-?

See also[edit]

  • Health in Toronto
  • Toronto EMS

External links[edit]

  • http://www.toronto.ca/health/
